title: Self-hosting your own media considered harmful according to YouTube
author: DavideNL
aiHeadline: Self-hosting your own media? Oh, the irony! YouTube, the king of user-generated content, is now telling you it's harmful to host your own media. Because clearly, trusting a giant tech company with your data is the safer choice.

title: Meta: Shut down your invasive AI Discover feed
author: speckx
aiHeadline: Meta's AI Discover feed is so invasive, even Meta wants you to shut it down. Because what better way to protect your privacy than to have the company that made it tell you to turn it off?

title: How we decreased GitLab repo backup times from 48 hours to 41 minutes
author: immortaljoe
aiHeadline: GitLab's repo backup times have gone from 48 hours to 41 minutes, proving that sometimes, progress is just a matter of shaving off a few hours. Because who doesn't love waiting 41 minutes instead of 48?

title: Jepsen: TigerBeetle 0.16.11
author: aphyr
aiHeadline: Jepsen's analysis of TigerBeetle 0.16.11 is here, and it's probably filled with enough technical jargon to make your head spin. But hey, at least it's thorough, right?

title: Dystopian tales of that time when I sold out to Google
author: stego-tech
aiHeadline: Dystopian tales of selling out to Google? Sounds like a memoir filled with regret, awkward memories, and probably a few lessons learned the hard way. Because who doesn't love a good 'I sold my soul to the devil' story?
